I would give this response a grade of 90.

The response accurately explores the transformation of the cross from a symbol of shame and suffering to one of hope, victory, and eternal life through Jesus' resurrection. It also acknowledges the early Christian perception of the cross as a symbol of death due to its association with crucifixion, which is in line with the concern that this transformation occurs.

The response provides several factors that contributed to this change in perception, including the belief in Jesus' resurrection, the adoption of the fish symbol, the spread of Christianity, and the liturgical use of the cross. This shows a good understanding of the historical context and the ways in which early Christians came to view the cross as a powerful symbol.

The only area for improvement is that the response could be more concise and focused on the main theme of the transformation of the cross from a symbol of death to one of life and hope. Some of the supporting details, while interesting, are not directly related to this central concern. Nevertheless, overall, this is an excellent response that effectively explores the topic.
